text: Hi there! Quick question, if I want to start to test my package against 1.6, can I just add -1.6 in version list in the ci.yml file? Or is there something to do because 1.6 is not released yet?

elements.text: Hi there! Quick question, if I want to start to test my package against 1.6, can I just add -1.6 in version list in the ci.yml file? Or is there something to do because 1.6 is not released yet?

text: in case it isn't clear enough, you can either use `^1.6.0-0` or `1.6-nightly`.  they're slightly different builds: `^1.6.0-0` matches betas, RCs, nightly matches nightly builds on the 1.6 branch

elements.text: in case it isn't clear enough, you can either use
matches betas, RCs, nightly matches nightly builds on the 1.6 branch

text: Thank you so much! I will probably go with ^1.6.0-0

elements.text: Thank you so much! I will probably go with ^1.6.0-0
